column4: I note that unlike breezy, I cannot so easily obtain access to other drives on my machine. Says I don't have permissions.
And it says there is no active partition, but it boots so there has to be, otherwise, I got it working ok.
Interesting. Well it goes into group and works that way.
Strange that it would gripe that I don't have one. Oh well, minor problems, nice fast screensavers once ye get the nvidia-glx installed in the new dapper.
maybe that media sourc is on a read only partition?
sec, Babo I have a link that fixes that ... sec ...
is it the nvidia linux driver install script ?
I can't follow that link or read the tutorial because I can't startx ...
that's really strange then. Since the instructions on the easyubuntu site use the cmd line ...
what do you mean something else ?
ok, I'll try it now. But ubuntu installs perfectly without having to mess around with the nvidia drivers. I got x up and used easyubuntu fine last time ...
oh ok, well if X is working than great. No need to follow the link, but might be useful later.
